attributes.action: To review divorce laws on equalization of pensions and assets
attributes.additional_details: It is unfair that a spouse expects 50% of assets when they have not supported the relationship financially but are capable of working but choose not to. I paid into my company pension since I was 18 moved in with my partner at 26 and after a 38 year relationship he leaves me & expects 50% of my pension even though he did not financially support the relationship. The spouse needs to prove they have financially supported the relationship before settlement is made in a court of law
attributes.background: To review the divorce laws on division of assets. A spouse must be able to prove that they equally contributed financially before being awarded 50% of their partners pension & assets. This should not apply if children are involved & the spouse gave up a career to bring up a family.

rejection.details:
Reaching an agreement on the separation of finances during a divorce is a matter for the separating parties, and if they can't agree, the courts. It is not a matter for the UK Government or Parliament.

You could have a petition calling for the Government to require courts to calculate divorce settlements based on a fixed formula, if that is something you'd like to see happen.
